intro: Palmeria dallmannensis, commonly known as the Dallmann’s palmeria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to the harsh conditions of its environment. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
